comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: This picture shows the British Aerial Transport (B.A.T.) FK.25 Basilisk a larger and more powerful development of the B.A.T. FK.23 Bantam. This design was too late for WW1 and the first flight was probably in the beginning of 1919. Only two machines built. No orders followed. The pilot's seat was placed behind the wings and for a clear view there is a cut out on the upper wing.
